title: A Man Discovers His Girlfriend's Peculiar Home Life in the Delightfully Macabre Peaches & Scream
description:
Thomas is excited to visit his girlfriend Anna’s family home for the first time—but is startled to realize that a) it’s a freaking castle, and b) Anna’s dead relatives are still, uh, in residence. From Danish writer-director Adrian Kirk Ejsing, horror short Peaches & Scream takes an original idea and runs with it in a…

Read more...

title: Elon Musk Seems to Think His Own Employees Are Shadowbanning Him
description:
Elon Musk loves Twitter so much, he spent $44 billion buying it. But now, under the billionaire’s leadership, the site isn’t doing so hot. Between layoffs and quasi-voluntary departures, Twitter has lost more than an estimated three-quarters of the staff it once had.

Read more...

title: The Chicken Sandwich Wars Have a New Contender: Cauliflower
description:
Christian conservative chicken chain Chick-Fil-A is well known for its advertising mantra “eat more chicken,” but the restaurant’s latest experiment will eschew animal products in favor of a “plant-forward” alternative. On Monday February 13, Chick-fil-A will test a new cauliflower sandwich in three markets; Denver,…

Read more...

title: FBI Finds New Information About Chinese Spy Balloon
description:
We’re learning new information about the suspected Chinese surveillance balloon that was shot down off the coast of South Carolina on Saturday. A State Department spokesperson said the balloon was able to collect communications and data via a satellite and had “multiple antennas” in addition to other equipment used…

Read more...

title: Scientists Will Pay You Over $4,000 to Chug a Diarrhea Drink
description:
Would you be willing to potentially endure a week’s worth of diarrhea for some cold hard cash? If you said yes, then you’re in luck. Researchers at Emory University are now recruiting healthy volunteers to take part in a trial that will test an experimental oral vaccine against Shigella bacteria, which cause a common…

Read more...

title: Amazon Scores FCC Approval to Deploy Over 3,000 Broadband Satellites
description:
The Federal Communications Commission has granted approval to Amazon subsidiary Kuiper Systems to deploy its constellation of 3,236 broadband satellites. The approval comes with the caveat that Amazon must retire satellites seven years after deployment and report satellite launches to the FCC on a regular basis.

Read more...

title: James Gunn and Zack Snyder Talked, Everybody Panic (Nobody Panic)
description:
Tweet anything about James Gunn or DC Films and you’ll see it. Passionate fans fed up that the DC films Zack Snyder helped usher in over the past decade are being all but forgotten. “Restore the Snyder Verse” is one battle cry. “Fire James Gunn” is another. And a third was so ridiculous, it made Gunn publically reveal…

Read more...

title: WHO Warns Bird Flu Could Jump to Humans
description:
The World Health Organization has issued an ominous warning about bird flu. In a Wednesday press briefing, the international agency’s director-general, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, noted that the disease’s current trajectory leaves humans worryingly exposed.

Read more...

title: How Kang Became Marvel's Next Supervillain and Why Phase 4 Sets It All Up
description:
The Marvel Cinematic Universe has reached its turning point. After two years of introducing all sorts of characters and concepts, the upcoming release of Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania should begin to put everything back into focus, and on a path that aims right at two more Avengers movies.

Read more...

title: Yahoo Says It Will Cut More Than 1,600 Employees
description:
Yahoo, the legacy site that’s seen its ups and down over the years, is definitively heading toward a down. The company confirmed that it plans to let go of more than 20% of its global workforce in an apparent shift of its ambitious advertising platform that looked to compete with the biggest players in ad tech.

Read more...

title: Investigation Reveals What Caused Fatal Tesla Crash and It Wasn't Autopilot
description:
The National Transportation Safety Board (NTBS) concluded its investigation into the deadly Tesla car crash in Texas that killed two men in 2021. The investigation report released on Wednesday said the men, who were identified by KHOU11 as Dr. William Varner and Everette Talbot, entered the vehicle with Varner getting…

Read more...

title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures Will Premiere May the Fourth
description:
The Mandalorian will soon be back on Disney+, but for younger Star Wars fans—or any Star Wars fans who just can’t get enough of the galaxy far, far away—there’ll be even more to watch when Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures premieres on that most auspicious of dates, May 4.

Read more...

title: 10 Wacko Moments From Republicans' Hearing on Hunter Biden's Laptop
description:
When Republican lawmakers took over the House of Representatives late last year, they made immediately clear their intent to hold up alleged tech censorship of conservatives as a top 2023 issue. They kicked off what’s looking like a long year’s worth of hearings and investigations into tech companies this week by…

Read more...

title: Does Poker Face's Charlie Have a Kryptonite to Her Power?
description: Read more...

title: 2.9-Million-Year-Old Artifacts Suggest Ancient, Big-Toothed Hominin Made Stone Tools
description:
Oldowan tools are some of the oldest known in the archaeological record; made of conveniently shaped rocks or crafted from knapped stones, these tools made it possible for hominin species to survive in a hostile world.

Read more...

title: Now That Hydra’s Gone, the Crypto-Based Dark Net Drug Trade Is Still Trying a Comeback
description:
Fraudsters and illicit digital dealers made much less money last year than they did in 2021, though 2022 was still a record year for total stolen in crypto hacks.

Read more...

title: How to Pick a Sensor When Buying a Digital Camera
description:
If you’re shopping for a digital camera, sensor size is one of the first things you’ll hear about. Chances are you’ve seen terms like “crop sensor,” “full frame,” and “micro four-thirds” thrown around, but what do those terms actually mean? And is camera sensor size actually important?

Read more...

title: Iconic Disney Princesses Get a Modern Reimagining, Thanks to the Artists of CreativeSoul
description:
CreativeSoul Photography rocketed to viral success by taking fairytale looks from beloved Disney Princess characters and re-envisioning them as children from the African diaspora. The gorgeous series, which features young Black girls as Rapunzel, Cinderella, Tiana, and Snow White, earned accolades that garnered the…

Read more...

title: Donald Trump Is Officially Back on Facebook and Instagram
description:
Former President Donald Trump’s official Facebook account is back online, along with his Instagram. The accounts had been suspended from both platforms for over two years, following Trump’s role in instigating the January 6, 2021 attack on the U.S. Capitol.

Read more...

title: Chloë Grace Moretz's Twisty Sci-Fi Tale The Peripheral Will Return for Season 2
description:
There were a lot of things to enjoy about season one of Prime Video’s The Peripheral, including its sleek but gloomy vision of the future (both near and far-flung) and its strong protagonist in Chloë Grace Moretz. Not so great was its tangled season finale—but with today’s news that the show’s getting a second season,…

Read more...

title: California Lost 36 Million Trees to Drought Last Year
description:
Extreme drought and hot weather killed millions of trees in California’s forests last year, according to a new report from the U.S. Forest Service.

Read more...

title: NASA’s CAPSTONE Moon Probe Makes Strides Despite Incessant Problems
description:
The NASA-funded CAPSTONE probe has been working in a unique lunar orbit since November 13, 2022, where it’s setting the stage for a future space station and related space-based technologies. The $33 million cubesat appears to be getting the job done—no small miracle, given the endless issues that continue to plague…

Read more...

title: Elon Musk's Neuralink May Have Transported Dangerous Primate Pathogens Illegally
description:
Neuralink is facing new allegations of malpractice from animal rights advocacy group, Physicians Committee for Responsible Medicine (PCRM). The organization claims that the Elon Musk-owned biotech company improperly and illegally transported hazardous materials, potentially contaminated with dangerous primate…

Read more...

title: NASA Hatches New Plan for Troubled Water-Hunting Lunar Probe
description:
Lunar Flashlight’s journey to discover water ice on the Moon hasn’t been easy. NASA had to re-evaluate its original orbital plan on account of the probe encountering thruster performance issues and is now planning to move it to a high Earth orbit, from where the probe will only be able to scan the Moon once a month.

Read more...

title: Spider-Man Noir Is Getting His Very Own Live-Action Series
description:
It’s unclear whether or not Spider-Man Noir, a character voiced by Nicolas Cage in Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse, will be returning to that universe. But he is returning, and in a much bigger way than you probably imagined.

Read more...

title: Moon Girl, Devil Dinosaur, and Their Celebrity Friends Hit the Red Carpet
description:
With Disney Channel’s Moon Girl & Devil Dinosaur, Marvel is aiming to bring to introduce young audiences to characters they otherwise may not have heard of. (That is, unless they’ve been playing Marvel Snap over the last few months.) It’s a show very different from prior Marvel cartoons, both in terms of its visual…

Read more...

title: Tyler Posey Almost Played a Lost Boys Vampire
description: Read more...

title: 10 Valentine's Day Lessons Bob's Burgers Taught Us
description:
Bob’s Burgers—which was just renewed for seasons 14 and 15—is currently on a brief hiatus in its 13th season. It’ll be back on February 19, which likely means there’ll be no Valentine’s Day-themed episode in store. But don’t despair, all riiiight? There’s plenty of Belcher family love from earlier seasons to go around.

Read more...

title: Steve Bannon's Podcast Takes Top Spot for Misinformation, Calls It a 'Badge of Honor'
description:
Steve Bannon, the former White House strategist under Donald Trump and host of the War Room podcast, is again under scrutiny after a study revealed his show ranks number one for sharing conspiracy theories and misleading or false information.

Read more...

title: California Police to Influencers: Stay Away From the Poppies or We’ll Arrest You
description:
Authorities have learned about the value of picturesque fields of poppies the hard way in the age of Instagram. Since barring access and pleading didn’t work, officials in the small Southern California city of Lake Elsinore are trying a new tactic: Telling would-be Instagrammers that they’ll be arrested if they don’t…

Read more...

title: DJI Updated Its Entry Level Lightweight Drone So It Flies For a Full Minute Longer
description:
The DJI Mini lineup offers some of the best drones on the market for novice pilots, starting with the very affordable $279 DJI Mini SE. Today, DJI revealed an upgraded version of that entry-level model, the DJI Mini 2 SE, which comes with some minor performance improvements, and like everything else these days, a…

Read more...

title: How Big Tech Rewrote the Nation’s First Cell Phone Repair Law
description:
This story was originally published by Grist. You can subscribe to its weekly newsletter here. This article was copublished with The Markup, a nonprofit newsroom that investigates how powerful institutions are using technology to change our society. Sign up for its newsletters here.

title: Indiana Jones Has No Time for Old Jokes in Dial of Destiny
description:
Timescrimes director Nacho Vigalondo has revealed his next sci-fi movie. A not-so-final girl faces a bevy of slashers in Hunt Her, Kill Her.  Scream VI is promising new rules now that Ghostface is in New York. Take to the skies, spoilers!

Read more...

title: You Really Don’t Want to Know How Giraffes Flirt
description:
Giraffes are so stoic that many researchers once thought the animals were totally mute, making their romantic ventures something of an enigma.

Read more...

title: The EU Says Twitter Didn't Complete Its Homework Assignment
description:
EU officials are singling out Twitter today after the company’s report on the role of disinformation on its platform fell short of competitors like Google and Meta. Twitter now has until July to submit an updated report to the EU.

Read more...

title: Disney Flinches as 2.4 Million Subscribers Abandon Disney+
description:
Disney Plus should really start thinking about changing its name to Disney Minus. The company released its first quarter 2023 results late Wednesday, showing the company barely gained any subscribers in North America while losing millions more watchers in the wider global market.

Read more...

title: Watch Live: SpaceX Attempts First Full Static Fire Test of Starship Megarocket
description:
SpaceX is aiming to perform the first full-fledged static fire test of its upcoming Starship megarocket on Thursday. You can catch the action live right here.

Read more...

title: A Rookie Magic Auditor Finds His Footing in James J. Butcher's Long Past Dues
description:
If James J. Butcher’s name sounds familiar, particularly in a “writer of urban fantasy books” context, that’s because he’s the son of best-selling Dresden Files author Jim Butcher. The younger Butcher continues his Unorthodox Chronicles with the follow-up to last year’s Dead Man’s Hand—and io9 has a first look to…

Read more...

title: Mesmerizing Self-Stacking Lego Domino Machine Can Hit Two Million Topples Per Day
description:
A few months ago, Grant Davis designed and built a Lego machine capable of automatically stacking and toppling 120,000 dominoes in 24 hours. It was potentially a record-setting contraption, but Jason Allemann of JK Brickworks could absolutely shatter that with their latest Lego build.

Read more...

title: Twitter Blue Bug Seems to Let Users Keep Their Checkmark Without Paying
description:
Twitter CEO Elon Musk presented the revamped Twitter Blue subscription service as an antidote to scam content. When the service launched late last year, however, it spurred a raft of fake accounts that cost at least one pharmaceutical giant billions in stock market value. Now Twitter users say the struggling…

Read more...

title: Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube All Appear to Suffer Outages at the Same Time
description:
Did someone actually break the internet? It sorta seems like it. Users of Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube, some of the web’s biggest platforms, reported experiencing major issues on Wednesday, with many losing access to basic features and functions.

Read more...

title: The Airwaves Become Awfully Personal in Sci-Fi Short Midnight Television
description:
In a retro-futuristic, dystopian world that blends sophisticated AI with dial-up modems and VCRs, a lonely man despairs at having to meet his content-posting quota for the day. With nothing going on, he’s not inspired... and without enough “likes,” he’s not allowed to leave his house. Enter Midnight Television,…

Read more...

title: Disney’s Splash Remake Is Still Happening, With a New Writer
description:
It’s been awhile since there’s been an update on Disney’s planned Splash remake, and amid all the big studio news today, there’s been some traction on the sea front.
